Have some Crappypasta.
i was there. he came to my hous and gave me a nintendo 64 cartragde and i look at it and it say “here have mario”. I put in at the 64 and it was black for 15 minites. when it becam more, it sayed “mairo time”. a big mario poped up and it was like looking into the eyes of stan. i play as sonic and was chase by a big mario who had red eyes. he bleed out of eye and scream. i turn off of game becaus i was scare. i now hear a whisper it say “dont let him in, dont let him in” and it wont stop, ever. i hear a rustling in outside and i look out and see a big man standing and he screamed “GET INSIDE”

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5351c37463687204bc000000#post_5351c37463687204bc000000
I think it's pretty safe. Making a new deadly pathogen would take a lot of effort, and most biohackers are more focused on creating things like "glowing plants":http://www.glowingplant.com/.  Don't believe the anti-GMO and anti-biotech groups. The scientific consensus is that biotech and GMOs are safe.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5351ce93636872156f200000#post_5351ce93636872156f200000
No; I was talking about the fact that genetic engineering done crappily in someone's garage runs the risk of what you're engineering getting cancer and dying due to it causing faulty cell reproduction.

For plants it's fine, but for animals there's a reason why they do all sorts of long term testing on them.
